item.title: 又有四个州加入美国对苹果公司的垄断诉讼
item.description: 美国司法部在一份声明中说，周二又有四个州加入了司法部对苹果公司的诉讼，指控这家 iPhone 制造商垄断智能手机市场。【原文：Four more U.S. states on Tuesday joined the Justice Department's lawsuit against Apple Inc alleging the iPhone maker is monopolizing smartphone markets, the department said in a statement.】

item.title: 墨西哥将审查大众汽车工厂涉嫌侵犯劳工权利的行为
item.description: 墨西哥政府周二表示，墨西哥接受了美国提出的正式请求，对大众汽车墨西哥公司位于普埃布拉州的工厂涉嫌侵犯劳工权利的行为进行审查。【原文：Mexico accepted a formal request from the United States to review alleged labor rights violations at Volkswagen Mexico facilities in the state of Puebla, the government said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 纽约起诉强生公司
item.description: 法庭记录显示，纽约州总检察长周二对 Johnson & Johnson 提起诉讼，指控其违反了该州的行政法。【原文：New York's attorney general filed a lawsuit on Tuesday against Johnson & Johnson , alleging a violation of the state's executive law, court records show.】

item.title: 新的人工智能功能有望促进销售，苹果涨势喜人
item.description: 苹果公司周二股价攀升 6%，创下历史新高，此前一天，该公司发布了新的人工智能功能，旨在提高其设备（包括 iPhone）的吸引力。【原文：Apple shares climbed 6% to a record high on Tuesday, a day after unveiling new artificial intelligence features meant to increase the appeal of its devices, including the iPhone.】

item.title: 律师称，汽车制造商面临价值至少 76 亿美元的英国柴油门诉讼
item.description: 索赔人的律师周二在伦敦高等法院表示，全球最大的几家汽车制造商因涉嫌在排放测试中作弊而在英国面临着 150 万起诉讼，这可能会给他们造成至少 60 亿英镑（76 亿美元）的损失。【原文：Some of the world's biggest carmakers are facing 1.5 million lawsuits in Britain for allegedly cheating emissions tests that could cost them at least 6 billion pounds ($7.6 billion), claimants' lawyers told London's High Court on Tuesday.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：美国正在权衡对中国获取人工智能芯片的更多限制
item.description: 彭博新闻社周二援引知情人士的话报道称，拜登政府正在考虑进一步限制中国获得用于人工智能的芯片技术。【原文：The Biden administration is considering further restrictions on China's access to chip technology used for artificial intelligence, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 解说员：LVMH 集团和阿玛尼集团面临的法庭管理包括哪些内容？
item.description: 本周一，法国奢侈品巨头路威酩轩集团（LVMH）的意大利子公司迪奥制造有限公司（Dior Manufactures SRL）成为今年第三家被米兰法院接管的时装公司。【原文：An Italian subsidiary of French luxury giant LVMH , Dior Manufactures SRL, on Monday became the third fashion company to be put under administration by a Milan court this year.】

item.title: WeWork首席执行官托利将因公司退出破产程序而下台
item.description: WeWork 表示，首席执行官大卫-托利（David Tolley）将在周二晚些时候这家灵活工作空间提供商摆脱破产困境后卸任，公司将任命一位新的顶头上司。【原文：WeWork said CEO David Tolley would step down after the flexible workspace provider emerges from bankruptcy later on Tuesday and the company will name a new top boss.】

item.title: 波音飞机五月份交付量同比减少一半
item.description: 波音公司周二表示，5月份交付了24架商用飞机，约为去年同期交付给客户的50架飞机的一半，因为该公司继续放慢装配线的运行速度，以完成未完成的工作。【原文：Boeing said on Tuesday it delivered 24 commercial planes in May, about half of the 50 jets it handed over to customers during the same month a year earlier, as it continued operating a slower assembly line to complete outstanding work.】

item.title: 独家报道数据显示：巴拉圭大豆出口步伐加快，价格反弹
item.description: 路透社获得的装运数据显示，巴拉圭的大豆作物出口因今年年初河流水位低和价格疲软而受到延误，但随着全球需求增加和价值上升，农民加快了销售速度，出口势头正在增强。【原文：Paraguay's exports of its soybean crop, delayed by low river levels and weak prices earlier in the year, are gaining momentum, shipment data shared with Reuters show, as farmers speed up sales on stronger global demand and rosier values.】

item.title: 消息人士称，汉莎航空不太可能在 ITA 竞标中提供更多优惠
item.description: 三位直接了解此事的人士称，尽管欧盟反垄断监管机构正在审查汉莎航空竞购意大利国有航空公司 ITA 股份的事宜，但汉莎航空不太可能向这些机构提供更多的补救措施，尽管他们对长途航班表示担忧。【原文：Lufthansa is unlikely to offer more remedies to EU antitrust regulators scrutinising its bid for a stake in state-owned Italian carrier ITA despite their concerns about long-haul flights, three people with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 世界银行董事会同意设立气候 "损失和损害 "基金
item.description: 世界银行董事会周二批准了一项计划，由该银行担任一个基金的临时东道主，为受气候变化影响的发展中国家提供财政支持。【原文：The World Bank's board approved a plan on Tuesday for the bank to act as interim host of a fund that will provide financial support to developing countries impacted by climate change.】

item.title: 美国因维吾尔族劳工问题禁止鞋类、海产品和铝业公司进口产品
item.description: 美国政府周二在网上发布公告称，美国又有三家公司被列入实体名单，该名单禁止从涉嫌参与在中国强迫维吾尔族人劳动的公司进口产品。【原文：The U.S. has added three more companies to an entity list that bars imports from firms allegedly involved with Uyghur forced labor in China, according to a U.S. government notice posted online on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家：意大利检察官正在调查另外十几个时尚品牌的供应链 - 消息来源
item.description: 一位知情人士告诉路透社记者，在法国路威酩轩集团（LVMH）在意大利的一个部门因涉嫌剥削工人而被法院接管之后，米兰的检察官正在调查另外十几个时装品牌的供应链。【原文：Prosecutors in Milan are investigating the supply chain of around a dozen more fashion brands, a person with knowledge of the matter told Reuters, after a unit of France's LVMH in Italy was placed under court administration in a worker exploitation probe.】

item.title: 美联储降息预期缩减导致美国国债收益率持续走高
item.description: 路透社对债券策略师进行的一项调查显示，由于对美联储降息的预期减弱，美国国债收益率将在未来三个月内趋于平稳，到年底时仅会小幅下降。【原文：U.S. Treasury yields will plateau over the coming three months and then only fall modestly by year-end amid receding expectations of Federal Reserve interest rate cuts, according to a Reuters poll of bond strategists.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Spotify 将于今年晚些时候推出昂贵的计划
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二援引一位熟悉该计划的人士的话报道，Spotify 将在今年晚些时候为其最狂热的用户推出一项新的昂贵计划。【原文：Spotify will introduce a new expensive plan for its most ardent users later this year, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing a person familiar with the plan.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司在与维珍航空价值 1.6 亿美元的英国商标纠纷案中败诉
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空公司（Alaska Airlines）周二在与维珍集团（Virgin Group）价值约 1.6 亿美元的商标案中败诉，去年伦敦一家法院裁定维珍有权获得特许权使用费，尽管该美国航空公司已不再使用维珍品牌。【原文：Alaska Airlines on Tuesday lost an appeal in an approximately $160 million trademark case with Virgin Group, after a London court last year ruled Virgin was entitled to royalties even though the U.S. airline no longer uses the Virgin brand.】

item.title: 独家报道美国众议院委员会报告发现华尔街 "串通 "遏制排放
item.description: 美国国会一个委员会将于周二在路透社提前看到的一份报告中指控华尔街最大的公司与倡导团体勾结，迫使公司减少温室气体排放。【原文：A U.S. congressional committee will accuse the biggest Wall Street firms on Tuesday, in a report seen by Reuters ahead of its publication, of colluding with advocacy groups to force companies to shrink their greenhouse gas emissions.】

item.title: 世界银行称全球增长趋于稳定，但远低于疫情前水平
item.description: 世界银行周二表示，美国经济强于预期的表现促使其小幅上调了对2024年全球经济增长的展望，但警告说，到2026年，总体产出仍将远低于大流行前的水平。【原文：The World Bank on Tuesday said the U.S. economy's stronger-than-expected performance has prompted it to lift its 2024 global growth outlook slightly but warned that overall output would remain well below pre-pandemic levels through 2026.】

item.title: 一些北欧零售经纪商允许客户在特斯拉股东大会上投票
item.description: 一些北欧零售经纪商将允许客户在本周举行的特斯拉年度股东大会（AGM）上投票，这有别于他们的常规做法，因为投资者对此非常感兴趣，首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）也在网上发表了评论。【原文：Some Nordic retail brokerages are allowing clients to vote at Tesla's annual general meeting (AGM) this week, departing from their regular practice, after significant interest from investors and online comments from CEO Elon Musk.】

item.title: 数十亿欧元的俄罗斯战机搁浅诉讼在都柏林开庭
item.description: 周二，世界上最大的几家飞机租赁商在都柏林的一家法庭上与它们的保险公司对峙，这是一场长达数月的争夺战的开始，争夺的焦点是与滞留在俄罗斯的喷气式飞机有关的约 25 亿欧元（约合 27 亿美元）的保险索赔。【原文：Some of the world's largest aircraft lessors faced off against their insurers in a Dublin courtroom on Tuesday at the start of a months-long battle over around 2.5 billion euros ($2.7 billion) of insurance claims related to jets stranded in Russia.】

item.title: IAG 就欧罗巴航空交易向欧盟提出补救措施
item.description: 英国航空公司所有者 IAG 再次向欧盟委员会提出补救措施，以确保欧盟批准其对西班牙欧罗巴航空公司（Air Europa）的收购。【原文：British Airways owner IAG has again offered remedies to the European Commission aimed at securing EU approval of its takeover of Spain's Air Europa.】

item.title: 通用汽车批准新的 60 亿美元股票回购计划
item.description: 通用汽车公司周二表示，作为新股票回购计划的一部分，公司将回购价值 60 亿美元的流通股。【原文：General Motors said on Tuesday it will buy back outstanding shares worth $6 billion as part of a new stock repurchase plan.】

item.title: 亚历山大-汉密尔顿的银行有了新名字：纽约银行
item.description: 美国历史最悠久的银行正在更名。【原文：The oldest U.S. bank is getting a new name.】

item.title: 行业组织称，尽管电动汽车关税调查，中国汽车制造商仍致力于欧洲市场
item.description: 中国一家主要汽车行业协会周二表示，中国汽车制造商在欧洲的投资计划不会因欧盟对中国制造的电动汽车进行反补贴调查而受到影响。【原文：Chinese automakers' plans to invest in Europe won't be deflected by the EU's anti-subsidy probe into Chinese-made electric vehicles, a leading Chinese auto industry association said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 市场等待美联储决议和 CPI 数据，期货下跌
item.description: 周二，美国股指期货走低，盘中表现平淡，因为投资者期待着重要的通胀数据和美联储周三宣布的政策。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged lower on Tuesday, set for a muted session as investors looked ahead to crucial inflation data and a policy announcement from the Federal Reserve on Wednesday.】

item.title: 解说员：美国业界希望看到 "行政法中的伏地魔 "消亡
item.description: 美国商业利益集团希望最高法院在未来几周内推翻四十年前确立的一项法律原则，该原则在数以千计的有关监管行动的法律诉讼中支持了联邦政府的立场。【原文：U.S. business interests are hoping the Supreme Court in the coming weeks will overturn a legal doctrine established four decades ago that has bolstered the federal government's position in thousands of legal battles concerning regulatory actions.】

item.title: 泰国三起法庭案件加剧不确定性，令市场惶惶不安
item.description: 泰国的三起法庭案件，包括一起牵连总理的案件，加剧了东南亚第二大经济体的政治不确定性，并导致投资者逃离股市。【原文：Three court cases in Thailand, including one that has ensnared the prime minister, have heightened political uncertainty in Southeast Asia's second largest economy and sent investors fleeing its stock market.】

item.title: GameStop 业绩下滑，到期日临近，"咆哮的凯蒂猫 "期权头寸承压
item.description: 随着 GameStop 股价的波动和合约到期日的临近，YouTube 上被称为 "咆哮的小猫 "的股票影响者基思-吉尔（Keith Gill）锁定其 GameStop 期权头寸收益的时间正在流逝。【原文：The clock is ticking for Keith Gill, the stock influencer known on YouTube as "Roaring Kitty," to lock in gains on his options position in GameStop as the company’s share price wobbles and the expiration date for the contracts draws closer.】

item.title: 解说员：特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬福利会发生什么变化？
item.description: 特斯拉股东周四将投票决定是否恢复首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）被特拉华州法官否决的 560 亿美元薪酬方案，无论投票结果如何，都不会迅速解决问题。【原文：A Tesla shareholder vote on Thursday on whether to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package that was shot down by a Delaware judge will not provide a quick resolution, irrespective of the tally's results.】
